author: Keisuke Asaba
raw_text: Skip to content Issue 39 – December 2009 Cover Art The Remains Which Live Keisuke is a Tokyo-based Japanese artist that works in acrylic paints, watercolors, and Photoshop. He enjoys and has been influenced by 2D and 3D animated films. He wants to "draw the world that can only be expressed in 2D." ISSN 1937-7843 · Clarkesworld Magazine © 2006-2022 Wyrm Publishing. Robot illustration by Serj Iulian.

Skip to content
Issue 39 – December 2009
Cover Art
The Remains Which Live
Keisuke is a Tokyo-based Japanese artist that works in acrylic paints, watercolors, and Photoshop. He enjoys and has been influenced by 2D and 3D animated films. He wants to "draw the world that can only be expressed in 2D."
ISSN 1937-7843 · Clarkesworld Magazine © 2006-2022 Wyrm Publishing. Robot illustration by Serj Iulian.
excerpt: Clarkesworld Science Fiction and Fantasy Magazine and Podcast. This page: The Remains Which Live by Keisuke Asaba
